column1: Narrator : After maneuvering between a handful of fishing boats, NOMBATEAU docks in a little port. The air smells strongly of fish.
PlayerSpeak : It stinks here! Let's leave.
Narrator : The village is humble sized, but the town square is still wonderfully lively. It must be a hub that a few small islands around come to to buy fish.
column2: Narrator : At night, the plaza is empty. The inside of a few houses here and there are still lit.

column1: Narrator : Between two buildings, giving into the plaza is a narrow, dark alley. It looks like it's a dead end.
column3: Narrator : Not too far from the port, a big street leads further into the village

column1: Narrator : A the crew progresses on an alley that comes from the Town square, a smaller one branches off of it, leading deeper into the village.
Narrator : On the shore, a path leads to a handful of shacks. From the town square, an alley leads further into the village, another behind some scattering bushes.

column4: Choice : (follow the alley behind the bushes)

column7: Narrator : A few meters into the street, CAPITAINE sees a small shop.
column8: Narrator : A few meters into the street, CAPITAINE sees a small shop.
column9: Narrator : A few meters into the street, CAPITAINE sees a small shop.
column10: Narrator : A few meters into the street, CAPITAINE sees a small shop.
column11: Narrator : At the end of the street, a small path leads to a massive old house.
column12: Narrator : The street ends on another plaza. This village is definitely bigger than it seems...

column1: Narrator : At the end of the path, CAPITAINE sees a small stone well.
Choice : (go back to the town square) (leave)

column3: PlayerSpeak : If only I had a rope...

column2: Narrator : The bottom of the well is dark.

column3: PlayerSpeak : Yep, it’s too dark, i’m gonna need a rope

column2: PlayerSpeak : Still, we can see deep down in it

column4: PlayerSpeak : At last, we see bright & clear !

column1: Narrator : Despite the efforts of CAPITAINE to get down here, the well is empty... Not a drop of water.
column2: Narrator : CAPITAINE can feel a draught coming from a crack in the wall, barely big enough to go through.

column3: Narrator : After walking into the tunnel on the other side of the crack for what seems like an eternity, a stone door blocks the path of CAPITAINE.
column4: Narrator : After walking into the tunnel on the other side of the crack for what seems like an eternity, CAPITAINE finally sees daylight.
column5: Narrator : Once out of the tunnel, CAPITAINE emerges into a dense, dark forest.

column4: Narrator : It leads to a small beach, on which lies a shipwreck.

column1: Narrator : The street gets narrower and darker. A group of threatening, armed men are standing in CAPITAINE's way.
Narrator : The path leads to a warm and cosy-looking tavern.
Narrator : A few fishermen are selling their catch of the day on rudimentary stalls.
OtherSpeak : What do you need, good sir?

column2: Choice : Do you know anything about NOMTRESOR?
column6: Choice : How's life here in this lovely village? (quest)
column8: Choice : Telll me more about this place

column2: OtherSpeak : Of course, it's a legend well known where I come from.
column3: OtherSpeak : Nope, never heard of it.
column6: OtherSpeak : Oh it's beautiful and mellow!
column8: OtherSpeak : I dont have any time to chit-chat !

column2: OtherSpeak : Head DIRECTIONTOFORMULA, and you're sure to be in the right direction!
column6: OtherSpeak : We have great weather, almost no crime, the pirates stay out of our business...

column1: Narrator : Between a few shabby looking shacks, a small shop is open.
Choice : Lets go back, I don't trust it. (leave)
column2: Choice : Let’s check out the shop!

column1: Narrator : As they're progressing through the street, CAPITAINE starts hearing sounds of saws that gets progressively louder. The smell of wood and sawdust hangs in the air.
Choice : (go back to the town square) (leave)
